sub_topic: Determining the volume of a sphere.
message_1: A sphere has a radius of 5 cm. Find its volume (to two decimal places) using the formula for sphere volume: V=4/3πr³.
message_2:
Given the radius r = 5 cm, we can find the volume V of the sphere using the formula V = 4/3πr³.

V = (4/3) * π * (5 cm)³
V = (4/3) * π * (125 cm³)
V = 1.3333... * π * 125 cm³
V ≈ 523.5988 cm³

The volume of the sphere is approximately 523.60 cm³ (rounded to two decimal places).
